availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Reuben Eaton Fenton (New York entrepreneur and politician)

body.p: New York entrepreneur and politician. Chautauqua County, New York, native. Worked in the lumber industry. Worked as a land speculator. Member of the United States House of Representatives from New York from 1853 to 1855 as a Free Soil Democrat. Founding member of the New York Republican Party in 1855. Member of the United States House of Representatives from New York from 1857 to 1864 as a Republican. Governor of the State of New York from 1865 to 1868.

bibl.p: Gregory P. Rabb, "Reuben E. Fenton," (https://hallofgovernors.ny.gov/ReubenFenton) (accessed May 4, 2017).
